intro: Hedyotis centranthoides f. vestita, commonly known as the white-flowered bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and narrow, opposite leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a low-growing habit with prostrate or ascending stems. The varietal form 'vestita' is distinguished by its hairy leaves and stems, giving it a more rugged appearance compared to the typical form.
